pageContent: English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (Part 40)

Credits English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (40 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee) by Dr. Sant Singh Khalsa Downloaded in HTML format from www.gurbanifiles.com Converted by webmaster@ishwar.com For more sacred texts, please visit: www.ishwar.com 1

Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 001 1364 : 1 I would cross the oceans, mountains, wilderness, forests and the nine regions of the earth in a single step, O Musan, for the Love of my Beloved. ||3|| 1364 : 2 O Musan, the Light of the Lord's Love has spread across the sky; 1364 : 3 I cling to my Lord, like the bumble bee caught in the lotus flower. ||4|| 1364 : 4 Chanting and intense meditation, austere self−discipline, pleasure and peace, honor, greatness and pride 1364 : 5 − O Musan, I would dedicate and sacrifice all these for a moment of my Lord's Love. ||5|| 1364 : 6 O Musan, the world does not understand the Mystery of the Lord; it is dying and being plundered. 1364 : 7 It is not pierced through by the Love of the Beloved Lord; it is entangled in false pursuits. ||6|| 1364 : 8 When someone's home and property are burnt, because of his attachment to them, he suffers in the sorrow of separation. 2

1364 : 9 O Musan, when mortals forget the Merciful Lord God, then they are truly plundered. ||7|| 1364 : 10 Whoever enjoys the taste of the Lord's Love, remembers His Lotus Feet in his mind. 1364 : 11 O Nanak, the lovers of God do not go anywhere else. ||8|| 1364 : 12 Climbing thousands of steep hillsides, the fickle mind becomes miserable. 1364 : 13 Look at the humble, lowly mud, O Jamaal: the beautiful lotus grows in it. ||9|| 1364 : 14 My Lord has lotus−eyes; His Face is so beautifully adorned. 1364 : 15 O Musan, I am intoxicated with His Mystery. I break the necklace of pride into bits. ||10|| 1364 : 16 I am intoxicated with the Love of my Husband Lord; remembering Him in meditation, I am not conscious of my own body. 1364 : 17 He is revealed in all His Glory, all throughout the world. Nanak is a lowly moth at His Flame. ||11|| 1364 : 18 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 001 3

Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee: 1364 : 19 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1364 : 20 Kabeer, my rosary is my tongue, upon which the Lord's Name is strung. 1364 : 21 From the very beginning, and throughout the ages, all the devotees abide in tranquil peace. ||1|| 1364 : 22 Kabeer, everyone laughs at my social class. 1364 : 23 I am a sacrifice to this social class, in which I chant and meditate on the Creator. ||2|| 1364 : 24 Kabeer, why do you stumble? Why does your soul waver? 1364 : 25 He is the Lord of all comforts and peace; drink in the Sublime Essence of the Lord's Name. ||3|| 1364 : 26 Kabeer, earrings made of gold and studded with jewels, 1364 : 27 look like burnt twigs, if the Name is not in the mind. ||4|| Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 001 4

1364 : 28 Kabeer, rare is such a person, who remains dead while yet alive. 1364 : 29 Singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, he is fearless. Wherever I look, the Lord is there. ||5|| 1364 : 30 Kabeer, on the day when I die, afterwards there shall be bliss. 1364 : 31 I shall meet with my Lord God. Those with me shall meditate and vibrate on the Lord of the Universe. ||6|| 1364 : 32 Kabeer, I am the worst of all. Everyone else is good. 1364 : 33 Whoever understands this is a friend of mine. ||7|| 1364 : 34 Kabeer, she came to me in various forms and disguises. 1364 : 35 My Guru saved me, and now she bows humbly to me. ||8|| 1364 : 36 Kabeer, kill only that, which, when killed, shall bring peace. 1364 : 37 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 001 5

Everyone shall call you good, very good, and no one shall think you are bad. ||9|| 1364 : 38 Kabeer, the night is dark, and men go about doing their dark deeds. −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 001 −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 001 6

Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 002 1365 : 39 They take the noose and run around; but rest assured that God shall destroy them. ||10|| 1365 : 40 Kabeer, the sandalwood tree is good, even though it is surrounded by weeds. 1365 : 41 Those who dwell near the sandalwood tree, become just like the sandalwood tree. ||11|| 1365 : 42 Kabeer, the bamboo is drowned in its egotistical pride. No one should drown like this. 1365 : 43 Bamboo also dwells near the sandalwood tree, but it does not take up its fragrance. ||12|| 1365 : 44 Kabeer, the mortal loses his faith, for the sake of the world, but the world shall not go along with him in the end. 1365 : 45 The idiot strikes his own foot with the axe by his own hand. ||13|| 1365 : 46 Kabeer, wherever I go, I see wonders everywhere. 1365 : 47 But without the devotees of the One Lord, it is all wilderness to me. ||14|| 7

1365 : 48 Kabeer, the dwelling of the Saints is good; the dwelling of the unrighteous burns like an oven. 1365 : 49 Those mansions in which the Lord's Name is not chanted might just as well burn down. ||15|| 1365 : 50 Kabeer, why cry at the death of a Saint? He is just going back to his home. 1365 : 51 Cry for the wretched, faithless cynic, who is sold from store to store. ||16|| 1365 : 52 Kabeer, the faithless cynic is like a piece of garlic. 1365 : 53 Even if you eat it sitting in a corner, it becomes obvious to everyone. ||17|| 1365 : 54 Kabeer, Maya is the butter−churn, and the breath is the churning−stick. 1365 : 55 The Saints eat the butter, while the world drinks the whey. ||18|| 1365 : 56 Kabeer, Maya is the butter−churn; the breath flows like ice water. 1365 : 57 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 002 8

Whoever does the churning eats the butter; the others are just churning−sticks. ||19|| 1365 : 58 Kabeer, Maya is the thief, which breaks in and plunders the store. 1365 : 59 Only Kabeer is not plundered; he has cut her into twelve pieces. ||20|| 1365 : 60 Kabeer, peace does not come in this world by making lots of friends. 1365 : 61 Those who keep their consciousness focused on the One Lord shall find eternal peace. ||21|| 1365 : 62 Kabeer, the world is afraid of death − that death fills my mind with bliss. 1365 : 63 It is only by death that perfect, supreme bliss is obtained. ||22|| 1365 : 64 The Treasure of the Lord is obtained, O Kabeer, but do not undo its knot. 1365 : 65 There is no market to sell it, no appraiser, no customer, and no price. ||23|| 1365 : 66 Kabeer, be in love with only that one, whose Master is the Lord. Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 002 9

1365 : 67 The Pandits, the religious scholars, kings and landlords − what good is love for them? ||24|| 1365 : 68 Kabeer, when you are in love with the One Lord, duality and alienation depart. 1365 : 69 You may have long hair, or you may shave your head bald. ||25|| 1365 : 70 Kabeer, the world is a room filled with black soot; the blind fall into its trap. 1365 : 71 I am a sacrifice to those who are thrown in, and still escape. ||26|| 1365 : 72 Kabeer, this body shall perish; save it, if you can. 1365 : 73 Even those who have tens of thousands and millions, must depart bare−footed in the end. ||27|| 1365 : 74 Kabeer, this body shall perish; place it on the path. 1365 : 75 Either join the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, or sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. ||28|| 1365 : 76 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 002 10
Kabeer, dying, dying, the whole world has to die, and yet, none know how to die. −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 002 −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 002 11

Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 003 1366 : 77 Let those who die, die such a death, that they shall never have to die again. ||29|| 1366 : 78 Kabeer, it is so difficult to obtain this human body; it does not just come over and over again. 1366 : 79 It is like the ripe fruit on the tree; when it falls to the ground, it cannot be re−attached to the branch. ||30|| 1366 : 80 Kabeer, you are Kabeer; your name means great. 1366 : 81 O Lord, You are Kabeer. The Jewel of the Lord is obtained, when the mortal first gives up his body. ||31|| 1366 : 82 Kabeer, do not struggle in stubborn pride; nothing happens just because you say so. 1366 : 83 No one can erase the actions of the Merciful Lord. ||32|| 1366 : 84 Kabeer, no one who is false can withstand the Touchstone of the Lord. 1366 : 85 12

He alone can pass the test of the Lord's Touchstone, who remains dead while yet alive. ||33|| 1366 : 86 Kabeer, some wear gaudy robes, and chew betel leaves and betel nuts. 1366 : 87 Without the Name of the One Lord, they are bound and gagged and taken to the City of Death. ||34|| 1366 : 88 Kabeer, the boat is old, and it has thousands of holes. 1366 : 89 Those who are light get across, while those who carry the weight of their sins on their heads are drowned. ||35|| 1366 : 90 Kabeer, the bones burn like wood, and the hair burns like straw. 1366 : 91 Seeing the world burning like this, Kabeer has become sad. ||36|| 1366 : 92 Kabeer, do not be so proud of your bones wrapped up in skin. 1366 : 93 Those who were on their horses and under their canopies, were eventually buried under the ground. ||37|| 1366 : 94 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 003 13

Kabeer, do not be so proud of your tall mansions. 1366 : 95 Today or tomorrow, you shall lie beneath the ground, and the grass shall grow above you. ||38|| 1366 : 96 Kabeer, do not be so proud, and do not laugh at the poor. 1366 : 97 Your boat is still out at sea; who knows what will happen? ||39|| 1366 : 98 Kabeer, do not be so proud, looking at your beautiful body. 1366 : 99 Today or tomorrow, you will have to leave it behind, like the snake shedding its skin. ||40|| 1366 : 100 Kabeer, if you must rob and plunder, then plunder the plunder of the Lord's Name. 1366 : 101 Otherwise, in the world hereafter, you will regret and repent, when the breath of life leaves the body. ||41|| 1366 : 102 Kabeer, there is no one born, who burns his own home, 1366 : 103 and burning his five sons, remains lovingly attuned to the Lord. ||42|| Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 003 14

1366 : 104 Kabeer, how rare are those who sell their son and sell their daughter 1366 : 105 and, entering into partnership with Kabeer, deal with the Lord. ||43|| 1366 : 106 Kabeer, let me remind you of this. Do not be skeptical or cynical. 1366 : 107 Those pleasures which you enjoyed so much in the past − now you must eat their fruits. ||44|| 1366 : 108 Kabeer, at first, I thought learning was good; then I thought Yoga was better. 1366 : 109 I shall never abandon devotional worship of the Lord, even though people may slander me. ||45|| 1366 : 110 Kabeer, how can the wretched people slander me? They have no wisdom or intelligence. 1366 : 111 Kabeer continues to dwell upon the Lord's Name; I have abandoned all other affairs. ||46|| 1366 : 112 Kabeer, the robe of the stranger−soul has caught fire on all four sides. 1366 : 113 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 003 15

The cloth of the body has been burnt and reduced to charcoal, but the fire did not touch the thread of the soul. ||47|| 1366 : 114 Kabeer, the cloth has been burnt and reduced to charcoal, and the begging bowl is shattered into pieces. 1366 : 115 The poor Yogi has played out his game; only ashes remain on his seat. ||48|| −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 003 −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 003 16

Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 004 1367 : 116 Kabeer, the fish is in the shallow water; the fisherman has cast his net. 1367 : 117 You shall not escape this little pool; think about returning to the ocean. ||49|| 1367 : 118 Kabeer, do not leave the ocean, even if it is very salty. 1367 : 119 If you poke around searching from puddle to puddle, no one will call you smart. ||50|| 1367 : 120 Kabeer, those who have no guru are washed away. No one can help them. 1367 : 121 Be meek and humble; whatever happens is what the Creator Lord does. ||51|| 1367 : 122 Kabeer, even the dog of a devotee is good, while the mother of the faithless cynic is bad. 1367 : 123 The dog hears the Praises of the Lord's Name, while the other is engaged in sin. ||52|| 1367 : 124 Kabeer, the deer is weak, and the pool is lush with green vegetation. 17

1367 : 125 Thousands of hunters are chasing after the soul; how long can it escape death? ||53|| 1367 : 126 Kabeer, some make their homes on the banks of the Ganges, and drink pure water. 1367 : 127 Without devotional worship of the Lord, they are not liberated. Kabeer proclaims this. ||54|| 1367 : 128 Kabeer, my mind has become immaculate, like the waters of the Ganges. 1367 : 129 The Lord follows after me, calling, "Kabeer! Kabeer!"||55|| 1367 : 130 Kabeer, tumeric is yelow, and lime is white. 1367 : 131 You shall meet the Beloved Lord, only when both colors are lost. ||56|| 1367 : 132 Kabeer, tumeric has lost its yellow color, and no trace of lime's whiteness remains. 1367 : 133 I am a sacrifice to this love, by which social class and status, color and ancestry are taken away. ||57|| 1367 : 134 Kabeer, the door of liberation is very narrow, less than the width of a mustard seed. Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 004 18

1367 : 135 Your mind is larger than an elephant; how will it pass through? ||58|| 1367 : 136 Kabeer, if I meet such a True Guru, who mercifully blesses me with the gift, 1367 : 137 then the door of liberation will open wide for me, and I will easily pass through. ||59|| 1367 : 138 Kabeer, I have no hut or hovel, no house or village. 1367 : 139 I hope that the Lord will not ask who I am. I have no social status or name. ||60|| 1367 : 140 Kabeer, I long to die; let me die at the Lord's Door. 1367 : 141 I hope that the Lord does not ask, "Who is this, lying at my door?"||61|| 1367 : 142 Kabeer, I have not done anything; I shall not do anything; my body cannot do anything. 1367 : 143 I do not know what the Lord has done, but the call has gone out: "Kabeer, Kabeer."||62|| 1367 : 144 Kabeer, if someone utters the Name of the Lord even in dreams, Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 004 19

1367 : 145 I would make my skin into shoes for his feet. ||63|| 1367 : 146 Kabeer, we are puppets of clay, but we take the name of mankind. 1367 : 147 We are guests here for only a few days, but we take up so much space. ||64|| 1367 : 148 Kabeer, I have made myself into henna, and I grind myself into powder. 1367 : 149 But You, O my Husband Lord, have not asked about me; You have never applied me to Your Feet. ||65|| 1367 : 150 Kabeer, that door, through which people never stop coming and going 1367 : 151 − how can I leave such a door as that? ||66|| 1367 : 152 Kabeer, I was drowning, but the waves of virtue saved me in an instant. −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 004 −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 004 20

Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 005 1368 : 153 When I saw that my boat was rotten, then I immediately got out. ||67|| 1368 : 154 Kabeer, the sinner does not like devotion to the Lord; he does not appreciate worship. 1368 : 155 The fly abandons the sandalwood tree, and goes after the rotten smell. ||68|| 1368 : 156 Kabeer, the physician is dead, and the patient is dead; the whole world is dead. 1368 : 157 Only Kabeer is not dead; there is no one to mourn for him. ||69|| 1368 : 158 Kabeer, I have not meditated on the Lord; such is the bad habit I have developed. 1368 : 159 The body is a wooden pot; it cannot be put back on the fire. ||70|| 1368 : 160 Kabeer, it came to pass, that I did whatever I pleased. 1368 : 161 Why should I be afraid of death? I have invited death for myself. ||71|| 21

1368 : 162 Kabeer, the mortals suck at the sugar cane, for the sake of the sweet juice. They should work just as hard for virtue. 1368 : 163 The person who lacks virtue − no one calls him good. ||72|| 1368 : 164 Kabeer, the pitcher is full of water; it will break, today or tomorrow. 1368 : 165 Those who do not remember their Guru, shall be plundered on the way. ||73|| 1368 : 166 Kabeer, I am the Lord's dog; Moti is my name. 1368 : 167 There is a chain around my neck; wherever I am pulled, I go. ||74|| 1368 : 168 Kabeer, why do you show other people your rosary beads? 1368 : 169 You do not remember the Lord in your heart, so what use is this rosary to you? ||75|| 1368 : 170 Kabeer, the snake of separation from the Lord abides within my mind; it does not respond to any mantra. 1368 : 171 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 005 22

One who is separated from the Lord does not live; if he does live, he goes insane. ||76|| 1368 : 172 Kabeer, the philosopher's stone and sandalwood oil have the same good quality. 1368 : 173 Whatever comes into contact with them is uplifted. Iron is transformed into gold, and ordinary wood becomes fragrant. ||77|| 1368 : 174 Kabeer, Death's club is terrible; it cannot be endured. 1368 : 175 I have met with the holy man; he has attached me to the hem of his robe. ||78|| 1368 : 176 Kabeer, the physician says that he alone is good, and all the medicine is under his control. 1368 : 177 But these things belong to the Lord; He takes them away whenever He wishes. ||79|| 1368 : 178 Kabeer, take your drum and beat it for ten days. 1368 : 179 Life is like people meeting on a boat on a river; they shall not meet again. ||80|| 1368 : 180 Kabeer, if I could change the seven seas into ink and make all the vegetation my pen, Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 005 23

1368 : 181 and the earth my paper, even then, I could not write the Praises of the Lord. ||81|| 1368 : 182 Kabeer, what can my lowly status as a weaver do to me? The Lord dwells in my heart. 1368 : 183 Kabeer, the Lord hugs me close in His Embrace; I have forsaken all my entanglements. ||82|| 1368 : 184 Kabeer, will anyone set fire to his home 1368 : 185 and kill his five sons (the five thieves) to remain lovingly attached to the Lord? ||83|| 1368 : 186 Kabeer, will anyone burn his own body? 1368 : 187 The people are blind − they do not know, although Kabeer continues to shout at them. ||84|| 1368 : 188 Kabeer, the widow mounts the funeral pyre and cries out, "Listen, O brother funeral pyre. 1368 : 189 All people must depart in the end; it is only you and I."||85|| −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 005 −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 005 24

Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 006 1369 : 190 Kabeer, the mind has become a bird; it soars and flies in the ten directions. 1369 : 191 According to the company it keeps, so are the fruits it eats. ||86|| 1369 : 192 Kabeer, you have found that place which you were seeking. 1369 : 193 You have become that which you thought was separate from yourself. ||87|| 1369 : 194 Kabeer, I have been ruined and destroyed by bad company, like the banana plant near the thorn bush. 1369 : 195 The thorn bush waves in the wind, and pierces the banana plant; see this, and do not associate with the faithless cynics. ||88|| 1369 : 196 Kabeer, the mortal wants to walk on the path, carrying the load of others' sins on his head. 1369 : 197 He is not afraid of his own load of sins; the road ahead shall be difficult and treacherous. ||89|| 1369 : 198 25

Kabeer, the forest is burning; the tree standing in it is crying out, 1369 : 199 "Do not let me fall into the hands of the blacksmith, who would burn me a second time."||90|| 1369 : 200 Kabeer, when one died, two were dead. When two died, four were dead. 1369 : 201 When four died, six were dead, four males and two females. ||91|| 1369 : 202 Kabeer, I have seen and observed, and searched all over the world, but I have found no place of rest anywhere. 1369 : 203 Those who do not remember the Lord's Name − why do they delude themselves in other pursuits? ||92|| 1369 : 204 Kabeer, associate with the Holy people, who will take you to Nirvaanaa in the end. 1369 : 205 Do not associate with the faithless cynics; they would bring you to ruin. ||93|| 1369 : 206 Kabeer, I contemplate the Lord in the world; I know that He is permeating the world. 1369 : 207 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 006 26

Those who do not contemplate the Name of the Lord − their birth into this world is useless. ||94|| 1369 : 208 Kabeer, place your hopes in the Lord; other hopes lead to despair. 1369 : 209 Those who dissociate themselves from the Lord's Name − when they fall into hell, then they will appreciate its value. ||95|| 1369 : 210 Kabeer has made many students and disciples, but he has not made God his friend. 1369 : 211 He set out on a journey to meet the Lord, but his consciousness failed him half−way. ||96|| 1369 : 212 Kabeer, what can the poor creature do, if the Lord does not give him assistance? 1369 : 213 Whatever branch he steps on breaks and collapses. ||97|| 1369 : 214 Kabeer, those who only preach to others − sand falls into their mouths. 1369 : 215 They keep their eyes on the property of others, while their own farm is being eaten up. ||98|| 1369 : 216 Kabeer, I will remain in the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, even if I have only coarse bread to eat. Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 006 27

1369 : 217 Whatever will be, will be. I will not associate with the faithless cynics. ||99|| 1369 : 218 Kabeer, in the Saadh Sangat, love for the Lord doubles day by day. 1369 : 219 The faithless cynic is like a black blanket, which does not become white by being washed. ||100|| 1369 : 220 Kabeer, you have not shaved your mind, so why do you shave your head? 1369 : 221 Whatever is done, is done by the mind; it is useless to shave your head. ||101|| 1369 : 222 Kabeer, do not abandon the Lord; your body and wealth shall go, so let them go. 1369 : 223 My consciousness is pierced by the Lord's Lotus Feet; I am absorbed in the Name of the Lord. ||102|| 1369 : 224 Kabeer, all the strings of the instrument I played are broken. 1369 : 225 What can the poor instrument do, when the player has departed as well. ||103|| 1369 : 226 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 006 28
Kabeer, shave the mother of that guru, who does not take away one's doubt. −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 006 −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 006 29

Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 007 1370 : 227 He himself is drowning in the four Vedas; he drowns his disciples as well. ||104|| 1370 : 228 Kabeer, whatever sins the mortal has committed, he tries to keep hidden under cover. 1370 : 229 But in the end, they shall all be revealed, when the Righteous Judge of Dharma investigates. ||105|| 1370 : 230 Kabeer, you have given up meditating on the Lord, and you have raised a large family. 1370 : 231 You continue to involve yourself in worldly affairs, but none of your brothers and relatives remain. ||106|| 1370 : 232 Kabeer, those who give up meditation on the Lord, and get up at night to wake the spirits of the dead, 1370 : 233 shall be reincarnated as snakes, and eat their own offspring. ||107|| 1370 : 234 Kabeer, the woman who gives up meditation on the Lord, and observes the ritual fast of Ahoi, 1370 : 235 30

shall be reincarnated as a donkey, to carry heavy burdens. ||108|| 1370 : 236 Kabeer, it is the most clever wisdom, to chant and meditate on the Lord in the heart. 1370 : 237 It is like playing on a pig; if you fall off, you will find no place of rest. ||109|| 1370 : 238 Kabeer, blessed is that mouth, which utters the Lord's Name. 1370 : 239 It purifies the body, and the whole village as well. ||110|| 1370 : 240 Kabeer, that family is good, in which the Lord's slave is born. 1370 : 241 But that family in which the Lord's slave is not born is as useless as weeds. ||111|| 1370 : 242 Kabeer, some have lots of horses, elephants and carriages, and thousands of banners waving. 1370 : 243 But begging is better than these comforts, if one spends his days meditating in remembrance on the Lord. ||112|| 1370 : 244 Kabeer, I have wandered all over the world, carrying the drum on my shoulder. Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 007 31

1370 : 245 No one belongs to anyone else; I have looked and carefully studied it. ||113|| 1370 : 246 The pearls are scattered on the road; the blind man comes along. 1370 : 247 Without the Light of the Lord of the Universe, the world just passes them by. ||114|| 1370 : 248 My family is drowned, O Kabeer, since the birth of my son Kamaal. 1370 : 249 He has given up meditating on the Lord, in order to bring home wealth. ||115|| 1370 : 250 Kabeer, go out to meet the holy man; do not take anyone else with you. 1370 : 251 Do not turn back − keep on going. Whatever will be, will be. ||116|| 1370 : 252 Kabeer, do not bind yourself with that chain, which binds the whole world. 1370 : 253 As the salt is lost in the flour, so shall your golden body be lost. ||117|| 1370 : 254 Kabeer, the soul−swan is flying away, and the body is being buried, and still he makes gestures. Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 007 32

1370 : 255 Even then, the mortal does not give up the cruel look in his eyes. ||118|| 1370 : 256 Kabeer: with my eyes, I see You, Lord; with my ears, I hear Your Name. 1370 : 257 With my tongue I chant Your Name; I enshrine Your Lotus Feet within my heart. ||119|| 1370 : 258 Kabeer, I have been spared from heaven and hell, by the Grace of the True Guru. 1370 : 259 From beginning to end, I abide in the joy of the Lord's Lotus Feet. ||120|| 1370 : 260 Kabeer, how can I even describe the extent of the joy of the Lord's Lotus Feet? 1370 : 261 I cannot describe its sublime glory; it has to be seen to be appreciated. ||121|| 1370 : 262 Kabeer, how can I describe what I have seen? No one will believe my words. 1370 : 263 The Lord is just as He is. I dwell in delight, singing His Glorious Praises. ||122|| −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 007 −− Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 007 33

Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 008 1371 : 264 Kabeer, the flamingo pecks and feeds, and remembers her chicks. She pecks and pecks and feeds, and remembers them always. Her chicks are very dear to her, just like the love of wealth and Maya is dear to the mortal's mind. ||123|| 1371 : 265 Kabeer, the sky is overcast and cloudy; the ponds and lakes are overflowing with water. 1371 : 266 Like the rainbird, some remain thirsty − what is their condition? ||124|| 1371 : 267 Kabeer, the chakvi duck is separated from her love through the night, but in the morning, she meets him again. 1371 : 268 Those who are separated from the Lord do not meet Him in the day, or in the night. ||125|| 1371 : 269 Kabeer: O conch shell, remain in the ocean. 1371 : 270 If you are separated from it, you shall scream at sunrise from temple to temple. ||126|| 1371 : 271 Kabeer, what are you doing sleeping? Wake up and cry in fear and pain. 1371 : 272 34

Those who live in the grave − how can they sleep in peace? ||127|| 1371 : 273 Kabeer, what are you doing sleeping? Why not rise up and meditate on the Lord? 1371 : 274 One day you shall sleep with your legs outstretched. ||128|| 1371 : 275 Kabeer, what are you doing sleeping? Wake up, and sit up. 1371 : 276 Attach yourself to the One, from whom you have been separated. ||129|| 1371 : 277 Kabeer, do not leave the Society of the Saints; walk upon this Path. 1371 : 278 See them, and be sanctified; meet them, and chant the Name. ||130|| 1371 : 279 Kabeer, do not associate with the faithless cynics; run far away from them. 1371 : 280 If you touch a vessel stained with soot, some of the soot will stick to you. ||131|| 1371 : 281 Kabeer, you have not contemplated the Lord, and now old age has overtaken you. 1371 : 282 Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 008 35

Now that the door of your mansion is on fire, what can you take out? ||132|| 1371 : 283 Kabeer, the Creator does whatever He pleases. 1371 : 284 There is none other than Him; He alone is the Creator of all. ||133|| 1371 : 285 Kabeer, the fruit trees are bearing fruit, and the mangoes are becoming ripe. 1371 : 286 They will reach the owner, only if the crows do not eat them first. ||134|| 1371 : 287 Kabeer, some buy idols and worship them; in their stubborn−mindedness, they make pilgrimages to sacred shrines. 1371 : 288 They look at one another, and wear religious robes, but they are deluded and lost. ||135|| 1371 : 289 Kabeer, someone sets up a stone idol and all the world worships it as the Lord. 1371 : 290 Those who hold to this belief will be drowned in the river of darkness. ||136|| 1371 : 291 Kabeer, the paper is the prison, and the ink of rituals are the bars on the windows. Shaloks Of Devotee Kabeer Jee − Part 008 36
